result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor C Schessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

No contact with Amy Schroeder.  Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.
Court will NOT allow expunction.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Taylor C Schessler in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:
Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
3 1/2 Years Imprisonment STAYED (Credit - 0 days )
-	18 months of Initial Confinement concurrent to any other sentence
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
No contact with Amy Schroeder .
Defendant to avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances.  
Fine $1380.50 to be paid as a condition of probation. 

Condition Time: 60 days JAIL concurrent STAYED
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Court will NOT allow expunction. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Taylor C Schessler in court with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count  #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Kershek requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
